intro: Zephyranthes fragrans, commonly known as the fragrant rain lily, is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often fragrant. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Zephyranthes fragrans is known for its ability to bloom after rainfall, hence its common name.
